alert.note: Alert for Marion; Schley; Stewart; Sumter; Webster (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 21 at 6:31PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Marion, southeastern Stewart, Webster, southern Schley and northwestern Sumter Counties through 700 PM EST ... At 631 PM EST, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from Seminole to near Westville to Sanford, and moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Lumpkin, Ellaville, Preston, Richland, Weston, Seminole, Kimbrough, Westville, Brooklyn, Draneville, Troutman, Friendship, Sanford, Church Hill, and Dumas. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
